Every single Member of Congress swore an oath to defend our Constitution. @HouseGOP & @SenateGOP need to join Democrats and defend our Constitution from @realDonaldTrump’s #FakeTrumpEmergency. pic.twitter.com/WhFvWICHMN

"With his declaration of a national emergency at the southern border, President Trump takes executive overreach to dizzying new heights. " I couldn't agree more. #FakeTrumpEmergency  https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/14/opinion/trump-national-emergency-border-wall.html … pic.twitter.com/cK5FgBygj1
As I see it, going around Congress to build this wall is UNCONSTITUTIONAL.  I’m sure the courts will agree.

The President previously signed funding bills that didn't include funding for his wall and funded other priorities. Money cannot and should not be reallocated without the express approval of Congress and the Appropriations Committee.

The Constitution is very clear. Congress has the power of the purse, not the President. This #FAKENationalEmergency is going around Congress & the @AppropsDems @SenateApprops to waste money building an unnecessary wall along the southern border.

The reality of the #FakeTrumpEmergency? It makes America less safe by stealing billions from crucial military construction projects that ensure our troops have the essential training, readiness & quality of life necessary to do their jobs effectively.

I stand with @SpeakerPelosi & @SenSchumer to defend ourConstitution. This “national emergency” scam violates our system of checks & balances, and undermines our Founders’ vision for our country. QT:  https://twitter.com/SpeakerPelosi/status/109644466311920435 …

The president's insistence on building a wall dragged us through the longest shutdown in history. Now he wants to declare a #NationalEmergency that will reallocate resources from other places to fund it, including from #PuertoRico's aid funds. This is absurd and disgusting.
Many of my constituents in #TheBronx have benefited from their services, and as Chairman of the @AppropsDems CJS subcommittee, funding this agency is one of my top priorities.

Great meeting w/ the @NYSBA to discuss funding for @LSCtweets. For many years, I have supported The Legal Services Corporation, which is instrumental in providing civil legal aid to low-income Americans. pic.twitter.com/vicgr9LQgn
